message: That's gong to be hard, you probably need to have a button in which you click to generate random numbers and they validate through jQuery. I they t
*if they get a certain combination, it will givethem points or something. Just use Flash and convert the .fla to HTML5 canvas through Wallaby
That's the easy way.
Interesting take. But I don't know any actionscript so using flash would be difficult.
Just a note on Wallaby, it's only supporting artwork and animation conversion to HTML5 currently.
It wouldn't be that hard.. Just float 3 ul lists after each other and add a slideshow (spinning) functionality with a randomized interval on it.
@fregu any live examples of jquery spinning effect implementation ?

Either you could speed up a slideshow like jQuery.cycle(), but I think I would rather create a sprite with all states after eachother and then animate the background-position (or in case of set it as background on a loong object and animate its top-position)
@fregu thank you for explaining. It helped it.
Why not just use Flash?  (kidding ;)
@vialetti lol

did one with flash some years ago, but the nasic idea can be easy transfered to jQuery. I think the key is to use a separated animation that simulates the turning icons. you could use a ani gif for that. on stop, you exchane or over layer the animation with a static icon..
for the animation, put some of the icons on top of each otger with pgotoshop and use vertical motion blur. move it int the slot machine slow up or down.. hope you understand my english.. sorry ;)
@monobasic that makes sense. I will hack something tonight using your advice. Any ideas on event handling forsomething like this?
the code is pretty ugly but you can see what they're using for the spinning effect
have you seen this? http://www.eyecon.ro/slotmachine/
@nyvirus1 saw that. Trying to figure a hack to make this look good.

I am currently working on a slot machine in jQuery (based on the  "eyecon"-version).... the code is still pretty ugly but it works pretty nice. (including 5 wheels, a drag handle, different messages per score, wait to respin ... etc)   I am still working on it, but I will opensource it when it's done.   DEMO:  http://slot.pixelass.com/
